English.Char_Desc_250: Txt2tags converts text files to HTML, XHTML, SGML, DocBook, LaTeX, Lout, Man page, Creole, Wikipedia, Google Code Wiki, PmWiki, DokuWiki, MoinMoin, MagicPoint, PageMaker, AsciiDoc, ASCII Art. Automatic TOC, macros, filters, include, GUI/CLI/Web.
English.Char_Desc_450: Txt2tags is a document generator. It converts text files with minimal markup as **bold** and //italic// to HTML, XHTML, SGML, DocBook, LaTeX, Lout, Man page, Creole, Wikipedia, Google Code Wiki, PmWiki, DokuWiki, MoinMoin, MagicPoint, PageMaker, AsciiDoc, ASCII Art. Console, web and graphical interfaces. Translated to many languages, extensive documentation and tools. A 9-year mature community product with 40+ team members. Simple, easy, KISS.
English.Char_Desc_2000:
Txt2tags is a document generator. It reads a text file with minimal markup as **bold** and //italic// and converts it to the following formats:
- HTML - XHTML - SGML - DocBook - LaTeX - Lout - Man page - Creole - Wikipedia / MediaWiki - Google Code Wiki - PmWiki - DokuWiki - MoinMoin - MagicPoint - PageMaker - AsciiDoc - ASCII Art - Plain Text
Free/GPL simple tool that works on Linux, Mac, Windows using command line, web and graphical interfaces. Written in pure Python, it's a one-file program that works with the default language modules, no need to install anything.
Translated to many languages, it has extensive documentation and helper tools. A 9-year mature community product, with more than 40 team members and hundreds of users. Follows KISS principle being simple and easy.
Features: simple, fast, automatic TOC, macros, filters, include, tools, extensive documentation.
